intro: Lundia hebantha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and thrives in humid, well-drained soil. It prefers indirect sunlight and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Lundia hebantha is often cultivated for its vibrant flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white.
